sorry i haven't posted anything in some time, but i haven't been in the mood, so too bad. so what's the deal with people interested in watching the video of nick berg being decapitated? i received a the video are traumatized with what you saw on that clip. in other news...average gas prices around the U.S. have actually hit over the $2.00 mark. so that means californians have been over the average for quite some time now. well prepare for the worst ladies and gentlemen, its going to keep going up. for those of you interested in knowing why, then keep reading, if not skip to the last paragraph. as you should know, gas prices are controlled by a small but very powerful force. these companies can control the price of gas because of the law of supply and demand (if you paid any attention in your economics class, then you know what that law means, if not, too bad). regardless of supply, demand for gas/oil will always rise. this is because gas is used to power one of our most prized possessions: our cars. some economic experts feel that these oil companies are holding back the supply of oil so the price will rise. the oil companies say that they don't have enough refineries to produce the oil. well, an oil refinery has not been built in california for more than 30 years. in addition to that, the oil companies have shut down a few refineries and will be shutting one down in bakersfield in the near future. so in addition to oil being a limited resource, we are limited to our refining capabilities. smart move by the oil companies, but bad for us. but it doesn't matter, because at the pace we are using oil, it will run out. imagine what we would be paying when there is only a small amount left. so my friends, if the government decides to impose that 50 cent tax increase to gas, don't be afraid. gas prices will continue to rise regardless. the theory is that if we can't afford gas, we will look into alternatives. hybrid, hydrogen/fuel cell, and electric. when the demand increases for these alternative sources, the car manufacturers will have to put more resources into research and development for these new vehicles. that means more choices for the consumer. one day oil will run out and we'll be kicking ourselves in the ass. if we can supress our use of it and increase its longevity, then i'm all game. however, it is tough for us as consumers to purchase vehicles such as the prius or the honda civic hybrid. like i said before, once our attraction towards alternative sources grow, so will the choices of alternative cars. there is no quick fix for our gas crisis. gas prices will continue to grow and boycotting gas for one day does NOT work! we just buy more the day before or day after. the only thing we could do is look to hybrid, hydrogen, and electricity to power our future. the virtues far outweigh the consquences. hydrogen and electric equals a cleaner future.
